page.title: 13Tamar Valley _ Weir Quay
page.content: This is an ancient deep-water quay on the Devon bank of the Tamar, with the old 'hards' now many feet under mud. Below the quay is a ruined lime kiln with double furnaces, and traces of other old buildings connected with the {industry}of the past. However, the old quay is still in regular use, as the fast developing Weir Quay Boatyard has laid down over 100 moorings, where there is special interest in the {employment}of repairing and caring for traditional wooden vessels. Boating,{fishing}, and water sports are proving a popular{recreation}for local people as well as visitors to the area. There are three houseboats moored at the quay, one of which, an old Tamar Barge, is permanently occupied.
